Just Cause 2 Multiplayer is revolutionary. No other game offers the same level of insane chaos this game can muster.

I've performed solo and combination stunts with friends while co-ordinating over voice chat. It truely is an amazing game with almost no limitations: the biggest is probably your imagination.

reviewText:
Chaos is the name of the game. As of writing this up, Just Cause 2: Multiplayer Mod is still in BETA, but it is also released to the public. Get your key at: http://www.jc-mp.com/

Right now there is no story, no structure, no rhyme or reason, other than pure chaos. If you don't want to just run around mindlessly, hopping in vehicles, flying around, blowing stuff up, shooting random strangers, and seeing all hell break loose in front of your eyes, then stay away. For everyone else, come join the fun! As of now, I only see 1 server. But it is listed as X/3000 players. Yes, it would seem up to 3,000 people can be on this server at a time. I mean, how stupid would it be with just 64 players? Panau is big. I mean REAL BIG! Luckily, you can transport to different places at will with easy commands. /tp + the name of an area will instantly teleport you. For example: /tp airport2 will take you to a military airport, where you can steal some airplanes. That is if you don't get mowed down by other players first. There also other commands, like /fp which will actually allow you to play in a first person mode. And oddly, it works pretty well.

Sadly, the community for the beta is pure garbage. The chat box will be flooded with spam pretty much 99% of the time. So ignore it like a normal person would. Don't expect any questions to be answered within the game.

This mod of course piggybacks off of Just Cause 2, and the download is extremely small, racking in at under 20mb. Just make sure you have Just Cause 2 installed first.

As of now there are no real gameplay modes, other than the ability to join races. Everything else is just one gigantic and enormous free for all.

See you all in game!

This is just a small impression, and not an actual review. I will be doing a full review after the mod is officially out of beta.

reviewText:
Like the name implies, this is a mod for the game Just Cause 2 and not a game by itself. You will have to purchase the full game in order to use this mod. What other gamers have done with this mod is take the Just Cause 2 gaming experience to a whole new level of multiplayer fun.

Pros    Hundreds of other players in one game world. Thousand players possible!
Server commands like teleporting, first-person view, increasing vehicle speed, and much, much more.
Custom game modes like racing, crafting, destruction derby, and tron all possible in one server.
Custom shops that allow you to spawn vehicles, weapons, and server items for free or using the server currency.
Roleplay servers.
Almost lag free on the most populated server.
Server chat and admins.
Passive mode if you don't want to be killed (but you can't kill anyone else.)
Cons
If there is lag between you and the other players, it will affect combat and some vehicle interaction.
Combat between players is largely left to vehicles and snipers/rocket launchers.
Not nearly as active as it was during beta testing or at release.
The map is so big that finding anyone outside of the main airport and some key locations may not be common enough.
Donor only items and features on individual servers.
NPCs may have been removed.
ConclusionI played for a few hours during the beta and then just now. A lot has improved since the beta but player count has predictably gone down. Still, it's hard not to have fun with this mod if you are looking to mess around with other people on a huge sandbox. I only visited one server during my play today--the largest one--but I'm sure the other servers can offer unique experiences of their own. Much of my time was spent playing the minigames like racing, tron game, and destruction derby. I also spent some time flying around using the speed boost console command (or key) to make cars fly and crash planes into other players.

The multiplayer that the base game needed is here in a very well done way.

reviewText:
Alright, played an hour of the mod, here are my impressions:

Just Cause 2, the base game, is extremely fun and huge and beautiful, everything a sandbox game should be. The multiplayer mod is all those things as well - however...

There are no NPCs. That means no civilians to hassle or cops to hassle you. At first I was annoyed by this (what's the point of a sandbox destruction game if there is no one to stop you?) but I realized that in the bigger servers, other players function just as well as civilians and cops. The server I was in had over a thousand people, and the max capacity of the server was apparently 10,000 - but who knows if that's really possible. Anyway, some of those 1,000 people will be jerks and try to kill you for no reason, some will just want to blow ♥♥♥♥ up with you. Still, lack of NPCs might hurt long-term enjoyment of the game and will definitely make private/smaller servers feel like you're in a very empty world.

There are no missions/quests. You can still run around the country blowing ♥♥♥♥ up and working towards 100%ing the map, but the story mode has been completely extricated from the game. This, plus the previous point, means its strictly a sandbox game now. Make your own fun. That sorta thing. If you played minecraft for ten minutes, said 'what's the point?' and uninstalled, you probably won't like this and that's fine!

That being said - if you're the type of person who can make their own fun, you'll love this. Lots of racing ranging from the serious to wacky (I finished 17th in a 25-man limousine race). Just Cause 2 Multiplayer

For anybody unfamiliar with Just Cause 2 here is a brief summary. You are Agency operative Rico Rodriguez and have been dispatched to the wondrous (albeit mythical) isle of Panau in order to overthrow the reigning dictator Pandak “Baby” Panay using a wide variety of weapons and vehicles but mainly blowing ♥♥♥♥ up and using your grappling hook to break the laws of physics along with your instantly respawning parachute. Okay? Good.
Suffice to the say when the game came out in 2010 it was pretty well received but it lacked any form of multiplayer or online experience. 3 years later and one small team of passionate develops later and now you can terrorise the island of Panau with thousands of other players, or you can just run them over with a neon pink bus…

Good Stuff

This game was a lot of fun just playing on your own, when you add a server of hundreds of people to that mix it’s 100% unbridled chaos. Each server hosts a different style of the mod, at it’s base level the multiplayer mod features a system where kills earn you cash and cash buys you weapons, vehicles and player skins. In addition to straight up murdering fools for cold hard cash you can also participate in events that take place all over the, quite frankly, gargantuan map such as races and demolition derbys. Not every server is the same however, some will force the charge for weapons and such whereas others will have the store completely free, some will have god mode and others will have the ability to alter the mass of your vehicles. All of this alone is enough to make this mod great, but its true greatness comes from the players. There’s no doubt that this game is best played with a friend because it allows you to wreak havoc upon other players and each other, a personal favourite between my friends and I is throwing buses at each other at high speeds using the overly hilarious “boost” feature which is activated when shift is pressed and dramatically increases your speed to ridiculous levels (even allowing boats to fly across the map).

It’s not all about harassing though, it’s the random events that people create that drive the fun in this game. Starting a convoy of trucks and driving up a mountain to a ski-resort sounds like something you would find in Euro Truck Simulator but when it involves 10+ people all talking to each other in chat and occasionally hurling cars at each other on the way it stops feeling like a server with blank names and starts feeling like a community having fun which tends to be lacking in multiplayer experiences as of late. The norm tends to be people informing you that they have slept with your mother several times.

Bad stuff

This game has a huge map full of diverse and interesting locales and in the singleplayer it’s also vastly populated, in multiplayer however there are no npcs to come after you when you blow up a power plant, no civilians to hang from trees. I can’t really complain about this too much because the fact that the mod exists as it does is a great thing. I’m no modder and can only imagine how hard these guys worked to create this mod so I can’t hold something like this against them especially as the mod is somewhat in its infancy in terms of large scale play.

So…

There are some things I would love to see make an appearance as I said, NPCs would be a huge addition that would really have an impact on the way the multiplayer works and could lead to some great in game events like overthrowing a military base. Also if I could grapple other players to stuff that would be fantastic. Besides those two very minor things that are 100% personal I can’t really fault it, this is a fantastic mod that has breathed life into a game most people had forgotten about and hell if it leads to Just Cause 3 with a multiplayer like this built in I will be bloody ecstatic.

Just Cause 2 Multiplayer

For anybody unfamiliar with Just Cause 2 here is a brief summary. You are Agency operative Rico Rodriguez and have been dispatched to the wondrous (albeit mythical) isle of Panau in order to overthrow the reigning dictator Pandak “Baby” Panay using a wide variety of weapons and vehicles but mainly blowing ♥♥♥♥ up and using your grappling hook to break the laws of physics along with your instantly respawning parachute. Okay? Good.
Suffice to the say when the game came out in 2010 it was pretty well received but it lacked any form of multiplayer or online experience. 3 years later and one small team of passionate develops later and now you can terrorise the island of Panau with thousands of other players, or you can just run them over with a neon pink bus…

Good Stuff

This game was a lot of fun just playing on your own, when you add a server of hundreds of people to that mix it’s 100% unbridled chaos. Each server hosts a different style of the mod, at it’s base level the multiplayer mod features a system where kills earn you cash and cash buys you weapons, vehicles and player skins. In addition to straight up murdering fools for cold hard cash you can also participate in events that take place all over the, quite frankly, gargantuan map such as races and demolition derbys. Not every server is the same however, some will force the charge for weapons and such whereas others will have the store completely free, some will have god mode and others will have the ability to alter the mass of your vehicles. All of this alone is enough to make this mod great, but its true greatness comes from the players. There’s no doubt that this game is best played with a friend because it allows you to wreak havoc upon other players and each other, a personal favourite between my friends and I is throwing buses at each other at high speeds using the overly hilarious “boost” feature which is activated when shift is pressed and dramatically increases your speed to ridiculous levels (even allowing boats to fly across the map).

It’s not all about harassing though, it’s the random events that people create that drive the fun in this game. Starting a convoy of trucks and driving up a mountain to a ski-resort sounds like something you would find in Euro Truck Simulator but when it involves 10+ people all talking to each other in chat and occasionally hurling cars at each other on the way it stops feeling like a server with blank names and starts feeling like a community having fun which tends to be lacking in multiplayer experiences as of late. The norm tends to be people informing you that they have slept with your mother several times.

Bad stuff

This game has a huge map full of diverse and interesting locales and in the singleplayer it’s also vastly populated, in multiplayer however there are no npcs to come after you when you blow up a power plant, no civilians to hang from trees. I can’t really complain about this too much because the fact that the mod exists as it does is a great thing. I’m no modder and can only imagine how hard these guys worked to create this mod so I can’t hold something like this against them especially as the mod is somewhat in its infancy in terms of large scale play.

So…

There are some things I would love to see make an appearance as I said, NPCs would be a huge addition that would really have an impact on the way the multiplayer works and could lead to some great in game events like overthrowing a military base. Also if I could grapple other players to stuff that would be fantastic. Besides those two very minor things that are 100% personal I can’t really fault it, this is a fantastic mod that has breathed life into a game most people had forgotten about and hell if it leads to Just Cause 3 with a multiplayer like this built in I will be bloody ecstatic.

The first time I logged into the beta server all those months ago I was greeted with a flaming passenger jet hurtling past my screen. The lag was terrible, shots wouldn't hit anything and the rocket launcher was insanely overpowered. Yet, despite all this I had the most fun I'd had in a game for ages.\n\nIn the subsequent beta tests the lag became far less noticable and in the prerelease version it was down to no more than internet speed. One should approach this game as something akin to Planetside 2; but as one constant battlefield, with no commander and the ability to spawn a Hercules Jet whenever you want. This game is the embodiment of chaos, and I loved every second of it.

All of the Just Cause 2's exploration and chaotic fun with multiple people, brutal awesomeness. Connecting vehicles together with the grappling hook, flying to the outer space with your tank, doing roadtrips from point A to B, Murdering everyone with your fellow factionmates, racing/derbying for grand price and after that buying vehicles to drive off mountains. There's just so many things you can do.

Multiplayer sync is great and very playable even with closer to 1000 players online at the same time. All of the in-game mechanisms work great. (teleports, racing, spending earned money etc.)

I highly recommend to try this one out. And huge thanks for the devs for making this diamond.
